title: DualShock 4 Setup Guide
description: Complete guide to setting up your DualShock 4 controller on various platforms
author: Padpedia Team

sections.title: Introduction
sections.content:
The DualShock 4 is a versatile controller that works on multiple platforms. This guide will help you set it up properly.

What you'll need:

  • DualShock 4 controller
  • USB cable (for initial setup)
  • Device with Bluetooth capability

content.caption: DualShock 4 front view showing all buttons and touchpad
Back view with L2/R2 triggers and charging port

sections.title: PlayStation 4 Setup
sections.content:
Connecting to PS4

  1. Connect the controller to your PS4 using a USB cable
  2. Press the PS button to turn on the controller
  3. The light bar will turn blue when connected
  4. For wireless use, disconnect the USB cable

Note: The controller will automatically pair with your PS4 console.

sections.title: PC Setup (Windows)
sections.content:
Steam Setup

Steam has built-in support for DualShock 4:

  1. Connect controller via USB or Bluetooth
  2. Open Steam and go to Settings > Controller
  3. Enable 'PlayStation Configuration Support'
  4. Your controller is now ready to use

DS4Windows (Alternative)

For non-Steam games, you can use DS4Windows software to emulate Xbox controller input.
